text.content: Yeah, I know what I am saying. If someone would have told me this 2-3 years ago, I would have lambasted the sucker off his pants. But the more windows are adopting open source, the more I don't want to leave it.

text.content: WSL - Making Windows Harder to leave

title.plain_text: WSL - Making Windows Harder to leave

text.content: Yeah, I know what I am saying. If someone would have told me this 2 to 3 years ago, I would have lambasted the symbol of ignorance, off his pants. However since Windows has started embracing Open Source more and more, their developer offerings have been getting much better.

rich_text.plain_text: Yeah, I know what I am saying. If someone would have told me this 2 to 3 years ago, I would have lambasted the symbol of ignorance, off his pants. However since Windows has started embracing Open Source more and more, their developer offerings have been getting much better.

text.content: Visual Studio Code, GitHub, Windows Subsystem for Linux(WSL) - are pretty popular and awesome offerings by Microsoft.

rich_text.plain_text: Visual Studio Code, GitHub, Windows Subsystem for Linux(WSL) - are pretty popular and awesome offerings by Microsoft.

text.content: There was a time when Microsoft was cut-throat against Open Source. Understandably so! as it directly challenged the paid offerings by Microsoft. But things have since changed and Microsoft has become one of the pioneers in Open Source.

rich_text.plain_text: There was a time when Microsoft was cut-throat against Open Source. Understandably so! as it directly challenged the paid offerings by Microsoft. But things have since changed and Microsoft has become one of the pioneers in Open Source.

text.content: One of the newest and astounding Open Source services is WSL - Windows System for Linux.

rich_text.plain_text: One of the newest and astounding Open Source services is WSL - Windows System for Linux.

text.content: Â itself is not open source. It ships along with Windows 10 and allows you to run many Linux-based Distros directly on a Windows machine without suffering from the overhead of a Virtual machine.

rich_text.plain_text: Â itself is not open source. It ships along with Windows 10 and allows you to run many Linux-based Distros directly on a Windows machine without suffering from the overhead of a Virtual machine.

text.content: Gone are the days of dual-booting Windows!!?

rich_text.plain_text: Gone are the days of dual-booting Windows!!?

text.content: Windows has released a new version of WSL - WSL2 with improved performance and integration with Windows. It has better File System performance as well as adds full system call compatibility.

rich_text.plain_text: Windows has released a new version of WSL - WSL2 with improved performance and integration with Windows. It has better File System performance as well as adds full system call compatibility.

text.content: WSL offers a great set of enticing features. Some of them include:

rich_text.plain_text: WSL offers a great set of enticing features. Some of them include:

text.content: Ability to run a wide range of distros - Kali, Ubuntu, Alpine, OpenSuse, etc. You can even have them installed simultaneously! Good luck installing them via VM on a single middle-spec machine.

rich_text.plain_text: Ability to run a wide range of distros - Kali, Ubuntu, Alpine, OpenSuse, etc. You can even have them installed simultaneously! Good luck installing them via VM on a single middle-spec machine.

text.content: You can open the distro file system in Windows Explorer and vice versa. It's like both of them are working simultaneously (and they are!)

rich_text.plain_text: You can open the distro file system in Windows Explorer and vice versa. It's like both of them are working simultaneously (and they are!)

text.content: Ability to forward ports - any application you run on localhost of a distro is automatically available on Windows localhost. So if you have a nodeJS application running on port 3000 inside the distro can be accessed onÂ

rich_text.plain_text: Ability to forward ports - any application you run on localhost of a distro is automatically available on Windows localhost. So if you have a nodeJS application running on port 3000 inside the distro can be accessed onÂ

text.content: Awesome integration with VS Code! You can directly have your development workflow on Windows and have it interfaced with your distro.

rich_text.plain_text: Awesome integration with VS Code! You can directly have your development workflow on Windows and have it interfaced with your distro.

text.content: I am no Windows fanboy, but Microsoft has been spinning up the Open Source game. Having said that! With the new Apple Silicon, it's hard to go for any Windows-based computer. But WSL is something that other OEM developers can include in their offerings.
